revised_title: Cornwall's Mild Winter and Rainfall in 1762
tldr: In a letter to Mr. Henry Baker, Reverend William Borlase shares his observations of the mild winter in Cornwall and the rainfall in 1762. He describes the weather as not excessively cold, with plants remaining healthy and in bloom. Borlase also provides a detailed account of the rainfall throughout the year, expressing interest in comparing it to the rainfall in London and other regions.
